source.author: Kiger, R.W.
source.title: Glaucium
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Kiger, R.W. (1996). Glaucium. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Basal leaves glabrescent to moderately pubescent; upper leaves not distinctly clasping the stem; petals orange to reddish-orange, usually with darker basal spots; capsules somewhat pubescent
Basal leaves densely pubescent; upper leaves clasping the stem; petals yellow or orange-yellow, usually without darker basal spots; capsules glabrous, tuberculate, or scabrous
